alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"... But Einstein himself says that the results of the experiment created 'one of the most dramatic situations in the history of science.' These results were not only totally unexpected, but they caught the scientific world completely unprepared to offer any plausible explanation."

- Einstein and Infeld, The Evolution of Physics, Simon & Schuster, New York, 1938, p.184 (In Dewey B. Larson, New Light on Space & Time)
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - The Effect of the Michelson-Morley Results - Part 2
